newsitem.title: GERMANY: SAP Q1 sales boosted by forex moves.
newsitem.headline: SAP Q1 sales boosted by forex moves.

text.p: Favourable exchange rate moves boosted sales at German software company SAP AG by 55 million marks during the first quarter of this year, a company spokesman said on Tuesday.
The currency effect accounted for eight percentage points out of total first quarter sales growth of 49 percent to 1.032 billion marks.
The spokesman declined to say, however, how exchange rate movements impacted on earnings.

The German mark depreciated from 1.54 marks to the U.S. dollar at the start of this year to 1.67 marks at the end of the first quarter. A weaker home currency tends to boost the revenues of export-oriented companies.
